org.jerkar.api.java
Class JkManifest

java.lang.Object
  org.jerkar.api.java.JkManifest

public final class JkManifest
extends java.lang.Object

Helper class to read and write Manifest from and to file.

The path where generally belongs all manifest past (relative to archive asScopedDependency)

Constant Field Values

BUILD_JDK

public static final java.lang.String BUILD_JDK
The JDK version who was running while bulding this manifest.

Constant Field Values

CREATED_BY

public static final java.lang.String CREATED_BY
The software that has created this manifest. Normally "Jerkar" along its version

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

of

public static JkManifest of(java.util.jar.Manifest manifest)
Creates a JkManifest from the specified Manifest object.

of

public static JkManifest of(java.io.File manifestFile)
Creates a JkManifest from the specified file. The file is supposed to be a manifest file. If the manifest file does not exist, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

ofClassDir

public static JkManifest ofClassDir(java.io.File classDir)
Creates a JkManifest from the specified class dir. This method looks at the META-INF/MANIFEST.MF file inside the specified directory to create the returned manifest. If no such file is found, an empty manifest is returned.

of

public static JkManifest of(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
Creates a JkManifest from the specified input stream. The specified stream is supposed to contains manifest information as present in a manifest file.

ofArchive

public static JkManifest ofArchive(java.io.File archive)
Returns the Manifest read from the specified archive. The manifest is expected to be found at META-INF/MANIFEST.MF. Returns null if no manifest found.

empty

public static JkManifest empty()
Returns an empty manifest containing only the "Manifest-Version=1.0" attribute.

addMainAttribute

public JkManifest addMainAttribute(java.util.jar.Attributes.Name key,
                                   java.lang.String value)
Add the specified attributes in the "main" attributes section. This method return this object.

addMainAttribute

public JkManifest addMainAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                                   java.lang.String value)
See Also:
#addMainAttribute(Name, String)

addMainClass

public JkManifest addMainClass(java.lang.String value)
Add the 'Main-Class' attribute to this manifest. This method returns this object.

addContextualInfo

public JkManifest addContextualInfo()
Fills the manifest with contextual infoString : CREATED_BY, BUILT_BY and BUILD_JDK

merge

public JkManifest merge(JkManifest other)
Creates a manifest identical to this one but adding attributes of an other one. Attributes of this one are overrided by those of the specified manifest if same attribute exist.

mainAttribute

public java.lang.String mainAttribute(java.lang.String key)
Returns the value of the main attribute having the specified name.

mainAttribute

public java.lang.String mainAttribute(java.util.jar.Attributes.Name name)
Returns the value of the main attribute having the specified name.

writeTo

public void writeTo(java.io.File file)
Writes this manifest to the specified file.

writeToStandardLocation

public void writeToStandardLocation(java.io.File classDir)
Writes this manifest at the standard place (META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) of the specified directory.

manifest

public java.util.jar.Manifest manifest()
Returns the underlying JDK Manifest object.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns true if this manifest has no entry or has only "Manifest-Version" entry.
